p: Interventions targeting transportation, including less private car use and more public transportation, bicycle, and walking, have a combined POB of 9.6% ( d = −0.136 95% CI −0.183, −0.089). However, combining all interventions targeting transportation reveals highly heterogeneous estimates ( I 2 = 98.4%) implying that very different effects are obtained for different types of transportation modes. Isolating the impact for decreasing private car use substantially reduces the POB to 2.5% with an effect size close to zero ( d = −0.036 95% CI −0.039, −0.034). This is a statistically precise estimate ( I 2 = 0%).
